page.title: 18REFUSE DISPOSAL GATESHEAD
page.content: The disposal works are situated on the site of an old Roman camp, hence its name, Campground Refuse Disposal Works. It has now become a landmark in Wrekenton and its chimney, about sixty metres high, can be seen all around. Most rubbish comes from the town but some is also broughtfrom Newcastle and Washington. Private traders come and pay to get rid of their waste. The Incinerator was opened in 1975. 60000 tonnes of rubbish are burnt each year. In burning, the weight of the rubbish is decreased by 50% and its volume by 75%. The residue after burning is taken to a tipping site in Birtley and is used for land fill. The plant is manned by 36 staff. It cost Â£2000000 to build and Â£600000 a year to run. Some people have said the smoke is dangerous to health,but this has not been proved.
